nodes.bodyText: Leftover?
No, AIUI this is necessary in order to populate the partition table.  It seems like a questionable API.

In the commit I just force-pushed, I changed PartitionTable so that the ConnectorTableMetadata was created in the constructor.  That eliminated the strange API, and allowed a bunch of data members to be final.
No need for this check. ClassCastException provides a good error message now.
Removed.
No need to validate input arguments to methods. If null is passed, the caller will get a direct NPE.
Removed.
This is a bit long, wrap the arguments to ColumnFieldDetails()
Wrapped
This seems to be unused
Oops, removed
Perhaps it's common, but I haven't seen "summing" used this way. It might be clearer call this just summary and name the methods like updateSummaryMin.
Changed
Don't static import empty() as the name doesn't have enough context to be standalone.
Refilled.
Revert this? Otherwise add a comment why this is only for ORC.
Yes, a left-over turd, now removed.

I think you can do this with https://prestosql.io/docs/current/sql/show-stats.html
Take a look at the SHOW STATS FOR usages in TestHiveIntegrationSmokeTest

In the most recent force-push, I've used SHOW STATS FOR everyplace where it works, and I like it better.  In Iceberg, pushing constraints down doesn't work in Iceberg for SHOW STATS FOR, so I left those massaged by hand.
We should also test statistics for all partition type, including non-identity (which won't allow restricting with a constraint ... but we should have a test showing how they work)
If we can do this with SQL using SHOW STATS, we shouldn't need to manually create constraints.
Actually, as of now, push-down of filters into SHOW TABLE STATS doesn't work in Iceberg, so until it does, we still need this formulation of the predicate.
I assume this should be IcebergOrcFileWriter
Fixed.

Using HiveUtil here is not correct, as Hive partitions are different than Iceberg partitions.
Related, PartitionTable.convert() returns a very Iceberg specific value. For example, floats are converted to ints using floatToIntBits(). And actually, I'm not sure why, since those values seem to be returned directly as the result of the partitions table.
I think the right way is to pass the constraint to getTableScan() rather than TupleDomain.all() and let the Iceberg library filter the matching files. After that, I don't think we want to deal with partitions at all. We use partitions for the Hive connector since it has statistics at the partition level. But Iceberg has them at the file level, so that's actually more accurate.
I think I get this point.  I'll take a swing at it.

I did this conversion, but ran into the problem that the Constraint predicate can't be carried in the TupleDomain passed to TableScan, so I still needed most of the machinery to create the map of per-column-per-DataFile NullableValues needed by the Constraint predicate :(

We should fork and simplify this code, since the Hive code will return return the wrong result for strings equaling __HIVE_DEFAULT_PARTITION__, plus the conversion logic is more lax than we need for Iceberg. For example, the Hive code handles multiple representations for boolean values, etc.
For this, the conversion can go directly from the value object to NullableValue. No need to round trip through a string. i.e. if the Iceberg object is a Long, we just call NullableValue.of(...) directly.
We want to avoid using Hive code that is "close enough" or that just happens to be the same (but might change in the future) for Iceberg.

This is fine. The constraint is simply a hint to allow the connector to optimize data retrieval. The engine still applies the filter to the returned rows.
From a semantic perspective, this table returns information about partitions. There is no filter that would (or should) affect the information for a partition (only filter out non-matching partitions). This is different than retrieving statistics where we want more accurate statistics about the filtered data that will be processed.

Got it, and thanks for the explanation.
I removed the comment.
Nit: parenthesis on lambda parameter not needed
Removed.
requireNonNull
Added for all args.
Nit: else is redundant
Removed.
